Summary: I picked this hotel because it was in between places I needed to be so ended up booking for 2 nights. Location was good and had lots of places to eat and shop around it. Beds left a little to be desired but everything else was fine and my stay was pretty comfortable overall.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review!  We've recently changed some of the beds.  Also, we're in the same parking lot as Target and have tons of restaurants nearby where guests can get a complimentary discount card.

Summary: The staff was friendly and we felt the room as clean enough. The bathroom could have been cleaner but for the price we paid it was acceptable. If needed we would be willing to stay again for a night or two but not a longer stay. The breakfast could use improvement but not much is expected from a free continental breakfast.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review!  Pictures of our breakfast can be found on our main website.

Summary Heading: Sound from the Mediterranean restaurant next door kept us up till 2:00 am
Summary: I wish I had known the very loud parties and thumping noise that comes from Mediterranean restaurant next door during the weekend. (We stayed in room 438)  I was told by the staff, who I went to complain at midnight, that this is the way it is every weekend. So we checked out a day early, then our planned stay and moved to another hotel. Staff member seem to call the restaurant for reducing the noise, but nothing much changed in the blaring noise and beats. I could only sleep after the noise stopped around 2:00 in the morning. I had to leave for 4:30 am, so I was not comfortable all day.  Rooms smelled of smoke and bathroom tiles were all cracked up. Toilet tank leaked water and made a gulp nose every few minutes.  Stairs were littered with trash, Trash at the bottom of stairs
Manager Response: This is totally unacceptable and makes me very angry that your stay was disrupted by our neighbors.  I'll be reminding the staff to call police regarding the noise issues.  There are noise ordinances that do not allow disturbances that you had!  Just for reference, as a hotel guest, you can always call the police as well if there are noise disturbances and the hotel isn't sufficiently taking care of the issues.

Summary: The rooms were not good! There was some sort of stain on the wall! The tables were sticky, the clock went even on, it smelt a bit like mildew! Worst of all, the door did not seal at all when you shut it! You could see the light from outside coming in through the door jam! And hear every little thing that was going on outside! We also almsot got stuck in the elevator! it wouldnt move and the doors wouldnt open! I will NOT be staying at this hotel again!!!!
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your stay!  If you'll let the front desk know about any issues, we can often move you rooms.  The room sounds like it's not up to our standards and the housekeeper assigned to the room will need to be reprimanded.

Summary: Room number 131 at this hotel is adjacent to the Hwy 91 and noise from this HWY is distinctly audible throughout the night resulting in poor sleep. We would not like to stay at this hotel again due to this one single reason.   This is a very old hotel and looks antiquated in the interiors of the room. All of the rooms require serious upgrade and a better getup.
Manager Response: We can always move you rooms if it's too noisy.  Just let the front desk know and we'll try our best to help.  I've slept in the rooms and I've found turning on the air helps to drown out the noise.  In fact, even at home, I've become accustomed to always having some kind of "white noise" to help me sleep.  I know it helps the babies sleep better as well!

Summary: This is our second stay at this hotel.  We like the proximity to Disneyland and easy freeway access as well as numerous restaurant choices nearby.  The rates are very affordable and the rooms are clean and comfortable.  We were surprised the first time we stayed with the comfort of the beds.  Believing we just got a room with newer beds, we were even more surprised the second stay when the beds and room were equally as comfortable and clean as the first.  Only complaint is need more pillows, though we didn't ask either.  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm very glad to hear you had a great stay!  We just replaced some of the beds about a couple months ago.

Summary: the room was clean, the bed was fair, there was enough towels and wash clothes for all. the stuff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review!  I hope your next stay is just as enjoyable.

Summary: This hotel is located about 1/2 mile from Knott's Berry Farm.  We were able to check in early, leave our vehicle in a safe location with the hotel, and walk back and forth to Knott's.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review!  I hope your next stay is just as enjoyable.

Summary: We both really enjoyed our stay. We love the -rices and the location. Its within walking distance of Knott's and other nice places to visit. The room was really clean and the bed was really comfortable. We will definately be recommending this hotel to others.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review!  We're in the same parking lot as Target which'll make your vacation even more affordable.

Summary Heading: The sink in the room has a very foul smell.
Summary: The sink in the room has a very foul smell. The staff were not courteous. The breakfast was foul and smells like the food over 3 days old. I would not recommend to anyone.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about the breakfast quality and the room issue.  We're attempting to go smoke free and pet friendly.  Please let the front desk know and we can usually switch you rooms.

Summary: This was our first stay here since the hotel became a Days Inn! We previously stayed here when  it was Red Roof Inn for the past 3 years! So we did not know what to expect with the new name, and we were not disappointed ! Major improvement with the continental breakfast, and hotel staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs! Will definitely chose Days Inn next time we visit California!
Manager Response: I'm glad you like the improved breakfast!  I hope you enjoy your future stays.

Summary: The first room we were given had a nonworking phone.  The Front desk said the maintenance person wouldn't be back until the next day.  Didn't offer another room until I mentioned it so we went next door.  Front desk said the only reason she switched rooms for us is because we were using our Wyndham Rewards,otherwise she wouldn't have done it.  I thought that was terrible.  Also, the next day I left a tip for the cleaning room service and a note that the shower drain was not working good at all.  We were standing in 3 inches of water in a matter of about 3 minutes in the shower.  By the time I returned in the afternoon they had never shown up to clean the room.  The cleaning lady knocked on our door about 4:00 aprox. but by then it was too late to let her in to do the room
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about the bad experience.  Our housekeepers clean from 9AM - 5:30 PM, so it's possible it was toward the end.  Please let the front desk know about any issues for the fastest response.   Sometimes the housekeepers can't read English, so a note in the room may not help much.  We can offer room changes if there are any issues with your room.

Summary: Room needed updating and definitely needed to be cleaner.  Bathrooms left with broken soap, no tissues and not enough towels.
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a room that wasn't cleaned well!  Please let the front desk know and we can find out which housekeeper cleaned your room.

Summary: The property was a former Red Roof Inn and appears to be in need of maintenence and minor repairs. Mostly Bug extermination. My first room had a rather large waterbug on the wall and evidence of more coming from the outlet near the door. I was changed to another room (upgrade) it had a broken light switch and baby roaches coming out of the recepticle (plug) near the TV. Overall the staff was very accomidating, property location very good, With exception of finding the entrance. There needs to be better sineage as how to enter the property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The beds were'nt very good. You could feelthe bed springs through the mattress. It seems every time I get a good internet deal I get a poor room on the top or close to the top floor. And when you are on an active vacation its tiring to climb all the stairs. Otherwise we had to take a detour through the lobby to catch the elevator if it worked. Days Inn is a good motel if you want cheap. Hope some day we can get back to staying at nicer hotels to enjoy the comfort
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a bad bed!  We've been in process of changing the beds.  Please let the front desk know and we can move you to a different room with a bed of your preference.

Summary: Good value nice people helpful the front desk made sure everything was ready to go and in working order.  The breakfast leaves something to desire every morning
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Pictures of our breakfast can be found on our main website.  The breakfast is pretty standard for all Days Inns.

Summary: this location was perfect for visiting  knott's berry farm and disneyland. i like it when the hotel is a little ways away. when ever i have stayed to close to the parks, there is alot of noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good Value - Staff were polite - Close to freeway and the noise kept me up a little during the first night..
Manager Response: none

Summary: Desk area is nice set up, but there should be an easy to access power strip for using laptop, printer, charging phones, etc.  The current electrical cord is mounted under the desk and you have to get on your knees on the floor to plug in equipment.  I have suggested a power strip be added in the past but never done.  Very inconvenient for the business traveler.  Also noticed the electrical outlets are worn out; by this I mean that you can plug in your cord and it will fall back out.  These are th ones on the wall to the right of the TV.  Tried to plug in my phone for charging and it would not stay in either the top or bottom recepticle.  These only cost a couple bucks, looks like a few could be replaced per week until completed.  My room on the last trip was 302, but common
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I have posted a Video Response on our main website in the "Reviews" section.

Summary: Hotel was clean and staff was extremely friendly. Room was clean and tidy.  I would recommentd this hotel if your going to Knott's, Disneyland or anything other fun activity nearby.  Close to everything including freeways :)
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I have posted a Video Response on our main website in the "Reviews" section.

Summary: We stayed there for 5 days. This was our second stay and were still pleased. We were on the back side by the freeway and you could hear it when the door was closed but not that bad. The room was a little out dated but it was clean and bug free. When we arrived they were scrubbing the walk ways. The hotel itself was clean and quiet. Room service was a bit off, we had to remind them to clean our room, but the front desk had it taken care of right away. Everyone there was very helpful and friendly. We will be back. Carol
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I have posted a Video Response on our main website in the "Reviews" section.

Summary: I asked for a room on the 1st floor and got it, very impressed.  room smelled of cigerette pretty strong.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I have posted a Video Response on our main website in the "Reviews" section.

Summary: the rooms are dirty, not clean towels and you hear the freeway all night and your neighbors.  staff is rude and unhelpful.  there has been at least two car breakins two a week, what was not disclosed to us.  There is not security monitoring the place.  Polilce are out here regularly for this reason.  The hotel staff refuse to take responsibility.  Women have been raped due to the officer . My husband and I stayed here for two night and our Mercedes was brokenn into - window smashed and everything taken out.  The manager was rude and unhelpful and disn't disclose that there has been breakin every week....and he could not be understood due to his accent.....Is he illegal????.  Please find another hotel.  Filthy, smelly and if you own a decent car expect it to be broken into and
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our Days Inn Knott's Berry Farm main website under the "Blog / Reviews" section.

Summary Heading: Terrible customer service and the hotel isnt much better...
Summary: I stayed here for approximately 7-10 days, the rates are reasonable but the hotel really needs to be updated. The pool area is nice and always clean the maintenance man does a good job of keeping looking good.  Agnes at the front desk is awful, gave me one price over the phone and when we went to check it was over $100 more!!  She told me that I heard her wrong!!  They make you get tickets for there extremely limited breakfast and most times we had to wait as the staff was down getting coffee or talking in the breakfast area.  I understand Days Inn has taken over and I believe one of the first changes they need to make is with the staff starting with the manager and working there way down. Would never stay here again.
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our Days Inn Knott's Berry Farm main website under the "Blog / Reviews" section.

Summary: Stayed for a week (June 20-26).  Front desk employees were always helpful.  Room was decent, but parts of the sink counter were chipped and the bathtub drain was clogged.  Carpet was clean.  The AC unit blows into the drapes, so it takes a while to cool the room.  Breakfast was muffins, hot and cold ceareal, breads, fruit, and coffee/juice.  Seating area was very small, only a few tables.  There was an elevator in the lobby which was convenient.  Housekeeping was excellent. This property is being converted to  a Days Inn.
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our Days Inn Knott's Berry Farm main website under the "Blog / Reviews" section.

Summary: I stayed here for one night last week.  I checked in late and the woman working the front desk was pleasant.  She told me that she had a "very quiet room" for me.  It turns out my room was right by the ice dispenser, which isn't very quiet.  Thankfully, it was only used once.  The out of order sign on the vending machine right next to the ice dispenser indicated it had been broken since April.  It's almost July.  The room was pretty gross, thin blankets, broken bathroom tiles, very old television which kept turning itself off, outdated decor, scratchy towels and a toilet that didn't want to flush.    I did not try the breakfast in the morning as it looked like you needed to visit the front desk before you could eat and I didn't have the time to spend.  It looks as though the
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our Days Inn Knott's Berry Farm main website under the "Blog / Reviews" section.

Summary: The staff who's doing the night audit today june 22, 2012 is rude and very inconsiderate. I understand if he couldn't let us check-in early. So we decided that inorder for us to stay while we wait for the regular check-in time is to get a room. But you can tell on his face that he's not willing to help us and want us to be charge for that room on a one day night rate plus a $10 each person. He saw that we got two kids with us. Then later, we decided not to get a room and we'll just wait. And that guy with a blonde hair with an eyeglasses his name is Frank or Brad (that's what he says) that we're not allowed to wait in the lobby because it's a hotel policy. To think we're here for four days and he treat us like that. He's not a good hotel employee neither have a job in a
Manager Response: Video Review Response posted on our Days Inn Knott's Berry Farm main website under the "Blog / Reviews" section.

Summary: The staff was friendly, and the rooms are super basic and a little odd. We got two rooms for several family members. (Even though I booked in advance and called to ask, the rooms were not connecting but instead were back-to-back). In one room, the phone worked but not the alarm clock. In the other room, the phone didn't work but the alarm did. One room had a mini-fridge but the hair dryer didn't work, while the other room did not have a fridge but the hair dryer DID work. There were only 2 towels in each room despite being 2-queen bed rooms. (If the room can accommodate a total of 4 people why only the 2 towels?) The carpet wasn't the worst I've seen, didn't make white socks dingy or anything but the bathroom was a little gross - there was a, ahem, hair stuck to the wall near
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is really good for the price and location. Lots of stuffs need upgrading such as beddings, upholsteries but overall we enjoyed our stay in orange county a lot. The staff was welcoming. It's close to Disneyland about 7mins, 30mins to universal studios, and LA zoo is also closeby. Lots of eat-ins around. You won't regret being here if you ain't looking for a four star hotel with a 2 star price-tag!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I decided to stay at this Red Roof Inn, though the reviews weren't glowing, and was a bit apprehensive, but to my surprise this property was a great value for the money.  The room was extremely clean and comfortable, as well as being quiet.  The bedding was fairly new, and I slept well every night there.  One disappointment  was there continental breakfast, which was very skimpy, with only one offering, muffins, but there were many places to eat within walking distance. The overall value of this property was excellent and would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference,and I was not very pleased to find the front desk young man on a personal call,did not greet me when I walked in, inattentive, did not ask or confirm any of the room details, offer the discount coupons,or engage  with me whatsoever, I asked him for a property map and he said "its right around back".  The grounds were unkept,cigarette butts in used cups,masking tape covering the fire extinguishers, Quiet room,clean carpets, a/c,fridge,heater, decent tv channel selection and excellent internet. The comforter had a hole in it, kinda gross. To go from the hilton or 5 Star hotels to this, but this a quckie 1 day trip.  I found the bathroom door to be a little dirty for my taste, some mildew/mold growth around the bathtub.  However
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here because we were in town for a family get together and woke up to bed bugs crawling on our phones...this place is discusting even the staff is rude and when we spoke to the management he was extremely rude. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Horrible; Disgusting; You get what you pay for
Summary: I stayed there last year for one week. Before I made my reservation, I read some of the reviews. But I won't believe especially those terrible reviews and like to have my own experience. And I really and really regret for my foolish.   The lobby, breakfast area, and room are dirty. Trashes are everywhere. They seems never clean the trash cans on the hallways. There is almost nothing for breakfast. And you have to be there EARLY. The coffee is just water with color of coffee.  The air condition was loud and had all kind of strange clicking sound. We could not sleep through the whole night. After almost one year, I still could not forget the terrible experience of staying there. That is why I decided to give my review even a year later. If you prefer to trust the good reviews just
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love the vast majority of Red Roof Inns and stay in them during my travels across the U.S.  Stayed at Buena Park last weekend (Oct. 8, 2011).  Property is safe, well lit, and convenient.  Staff was friendly.  Room was very comfortable.  Bathroom was exceptionally clean.  Just booked another night there for this coming weekend.  Reasonably priced.  You definitely want to take advantage of their sales & discounts when booking online, which took all of 3 minutes.  No breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in March 2011 for a trip to knottsberry...  i would not stay here again.. the drive up to the parking lot just looks dirty & well kind of ghetto... overgrown bushes and even the pavement is rocky.. room was not what I expected bathroom looked old & needed updating badly... one thing that was great is the front desk staff very helpful .. that is the only good thing about this place well and the location to knottsberry but if you can stay at the holiday inn express much nicer place....
Manager Response: Yeah, our bushes need some trimming.  We don't expect anyone to stay in a sub-par room.  We'll move you!   Just let us know and we can get you to a room that is to your satisfaction.  Compared to other deals, we offer a great value!

Summary: My 11 year old daughter and I stayed at the red roof inn on a spur of the moment trip to knotts berry Farm this past June. We did the same exact stay last summer. ILL start by saying it has a great location if you are visiting Knotts Berry Farm, Soak City, or Midevil Times. It is about a a 5 minute drive from Knotts Berry Farm which is straight down Beach Blvd so it is very easy to get to. There is a Dennys and black angus in the same parking lot and Fudruckers is a walk across the streat which is a very good hamburger place. Target is also in the same parking  which makes it convenient for those forgotten items. Both times we have stayed the front desk was very friendly. The rooms are very clean. On our first stay we had a king room which had a very large area with a desk .
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I'm glad you see us as a great value.  All our rooms with two beds are two queen beds.  Thanks again for your review!

Summary: We got a queen double. The beds were not hard like some cheaper motels. . I sheets were clean but stained a bit. Found a hair in the bath tub.Could have been the maids if she was leaning over cleaning. Because other wise it was clean. The room was not horrible just motels 6 grade. They had muffins and toast in the morning and coffee, tea, and oj from 6:30 till 9 am. At 8:30 there were not any muffins. Just toast and the above mentioned drinks. They had free internet use. We drove at night got there at 1 am and only stayed to crash and get up the next morning and go somewhere else.  I wanted to swim but it was only 8:30 and the pool wasn't open yet but they unlocked it and let me anyhow. Pool was not cold and was very nice. The hot tub was nice but the jets were on a timer and
Manager Response: Thank you for your very informative review.  If you have any issues with your room, usually the front desk can help take care of any issues you may have including moving you to a different room.  Thanks again.

Summary: I think these other reviewers must be friends of the owner of this dump. I just stayed at this dive on June 19, 2011. The bed has hard metal springs that you feel. The non-smoking room stinks to high heaven of cigarette smoke especially when you turn on the A/C. The shower leaks water all over the floor because of the new curtain that you can't get to totally close. The toilet BARELY flushed. The front desk guy was rude. The "continental breakfast" consisted of toast and muffins, and when we went to get something to eat at 8:30, there were only 2 heels of bread left...total JOKE! And then there is the NOISE. This place is shaped like an A. On one side of the A is the freeway, and on the other side is the Target parking lot where diesel trucks like to park and run their engines
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear your stay was unsatisfactory.  If you run into issues with your room, please let the front desk know and if we can't take care of the issue, we can typically move you to a room that is to your satisfaction.  If noise is a concern, I would recommend requesting a room that's on the 4th floor away from the freeway.

Summary Heading: reasonble value for the price , freeway noise
Summary: this red roof is in a good location for the tourist , easy walk to supermarkets (stater bros /target) and resturants /take aways .  there has been some re modeling sinse my last visit , its basic and could use further updating , the bathroom is pretty old and tired.   theres plenty of free car parking and they have a decent sized pool , one thing i will mention is this is very close to the 91 fwy and you will hear heavy traffic at all times through the night , we has the a/c on but if you are a light sleeper it may bother you.  summary..its ok for the price , just ok nothing special
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  It may also help if you check out your room first, and if there are any major problems, the front desk can move you to a different room until you find a room you're comfortable with.

Summary Heading: Great Value. Great Place to Stay
Summary: We aren't used to hotel rates being so economical and thought this must be a dump from the $45-55 nightly rate. It was recommended to us by family and turned out to be one of the best places we've stayed as far as cleanliness, comfort and convenience. The complimentary breakfast was only 1/2 muffins and toast with juice and coffee, but for the room rate we paid here we could go to the Denney's only a few steps away. We stayed in room 302 which is away from the freeway side and very quiet.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I'm glad you found us to be a great value.  Thanks for offering the tip about quiet rooms away from the freeway.  Often you may be able to special request this.

Summary: Great price, nice clean room and excellent location to good food. Brent was on duty and was professional, courteous and a pleasure to deal with. Five minutes to the Anaheim Convention Center so why get ripped in Anaheim on your room and having to pay to park where you get your room???? Makes no sense not to stay here. Thanks for a nice stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay and I'll be sure to let Brent know he has a fan.

Summary: If you've ever stayed in a hotel room and thought to yourself, "I wish my house was more like this," you're in luck.  This hotel is the one. From the time you step into the room, make you feel so comfortable.  The room so clean, the towel smells so good.  When you leave this hotel you will have a memory of it, and try to decorate your house the same way.  You want a good memory stay in this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for the glowing review!  I hope your future stays are just as pleasant.

Summary Heading: Great establishment for the price you pay!!!
Summary: Red roof inn offers better customer service than some of the high end expensive hotels that I have stayed at. The staff is completely nice and accommodates all your needs quickly and efficiently. The manager, Manuel, is very nice and even remembered my name the first time we checked in and remembered us ever since. He was always smiling and made us feel like VIP! The rest of the staff was really nice and offered a welcoming environment. The rooms are very spacious and some of them have a fridge and a microwave. The television had alot of great channels, like allllotttt, so much that the tv is actually worth mentioning in this review. There is wifi in EVERY room, unlike the other hotels that claim they have wifi but only in a little part of the building and you end up only
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I already let Manuel know about your review and your compliments.  I hope your future stays will be just as pleasant.

Summary: I really enjoy staying here  !!!  the entire staff is always friendly   !!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I already passed on your comments to the staff.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 18 days and were very happy with our stay. We have stayed at several Red Roof Inns and this has been the best experience so far.   What made the stay so nice was the excellent service of the front desk staff. The Hispanic manager was especially friendly and went out of his way to say hi to my kids every day.   The housekeeping did a great job of keeping the propery clean. We saw them carpet cleaning floors daily and even mopping the walkways.   We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we are in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!  I already let Manuel, who was the manager you referenced about your compliments.  Our housekeeping staff are very hard working to keep our hotel clean for your comfort.  Thanks again, and I hope your future stays are just as positive.

Summary Heading: my family and i have stayed here many...
Summary: my family and i have stayed here many different times over the last 6 months.  every stay was great. the staff is great. zeny,ricardo, and manuel have always went above and beyond for my stays. ive stayed in afew of the rooms and they have been spotless. the housekepping staff really take pride in their job. the management and staff make you feel great. good enough to make us stay here anytime.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  I have let my staff know that they have a fan.

Summary: Internet is blocked at every turn. No TV so you can not go online to  ABC, NBC, CBS nothing, almost 50% of the internet is blocked because of bandwith issues, they claim.  Television is the worst, 12 channels and not even CBS on a local level.
Manager Response: We have since removed blocked access to certain sites and are in process of upgrading our television system.

Summary Heading: Buena Park Red Roof Inn - NICE
Summary: I was pleasantly supprised. The few reviews I found made me skeptical. Had a friend suggest we stay here. The room was nothing fancy. More than adequate for our purposes. LA kept us so busy we were glad to have a nice place to crash. The room was clean, always ready when we got back. This place was quite busy the whole week we were there. When we checked in there was an issue being resolved by the police in the lobby. Sketchy patrons. We had a great time. We needed extra towels daily, never a problem for the front desk. They did everything they could to accomodate any of our requests. Went to Medieval Times, we walked, lots of fun. Knotts is just down the street as well. Pool and spa were kept clean. The spa could have been hotter. A few cig butts around the pool but nothing too
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not very clean, a lot of noise, no breakfast. Just do not book it
Summary: It is really a budget hotel. It is close to many restaurants and to Knotts Berry Farm. These are the only positive points. The negatives: they say that they have breakfast, but in fact is just coffee, juice and half muffins. I found a really dirty towel in my bathroom (really disgusting). The shampoo is just a sache (just one person can use it). The internet access is not very good and they block sites as Disneyland. And the staff needs to learn a lot how to be friendly. I really regret for having booked this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Needed a temporary place to sleep while all the bedrooms and bathrooms of my house were being remodeled. I picked this Red Roof Inn based on its location (nearby) and a couple past experiences (good) at other Red Roof Inns.   I made my reservation earlier the day I planned to check in for a four night stay.   Check-in was quick.  The room was clean and smelled fine.  Everything (heat, plumbing, TV, etc) worked fine.  The free wireless WiFi worked fine.  Bed was fairly firm, but to my liking.  Heating/ A/C unit was quiet. The room was always made up when I returned mid afternoons.   My only semi-negative comment is outside the Inn's control:   91-Freeway traffic noise.  The Inn is right next to a major intersection (Beach Blvd) with the freeway and the traffic is constant.  I
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I will start with saying that normally I tend to look for a place that is impressive, and I pay extra for it.  BUT, with starting school and budgeting normally, I decided to look around at something different for an unplanned family meeting.  The last time I was in California I had stayed at my sister's, and when I traveled an hour out of the way to drop a friend off, we decided to stay here and sleep before I headed all the way back to my sister's.  So I will describe both stays...  Finding the entrance would have been odd if I had not been with my friend who lived in that area most of his life.  You have to creep around a black angus and the medieval dinner place, which are all sharing a parking lot.  I like that directly for the fact that it wouldn't be a pain to get into
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I'm glad to hear you thought of us as a good value.  Our housekeepers typically ask you to leave the room due to security issues.  It's not safe to have housekeepers in a closed room with strangers.  It's nothing personal, but I want to make sure my staff is safe.  If you don't want to leave the room, the housekeeper usually can come back at another time when you're going to be out of the room anyway.  As for the towels, the housekeeper should had given you more towels instead of leaving you with none!  Please let me know if you have any issues with your stay that my front desk staff can't handle.  My direct contact information can be found at the front desk.  Thanks again for your review!

Summary: As a regular trip advisor contributor, I want to be fair and evaluate this motel within its proper category:  budget accommodation.  However, the problem I keep coming back to is that even with this category in mind, the property fell short on comfort and cleanliness.  But first, the positives:  conveniently located, near many food choices, friendly staff and our room #330 had a fairly new air conditioning unit that worked beautifly.  On the negative side, the bed was terribly uncomfortable and the bathroom was just gross.  Upon entering, the bathroom reeked of skunk--perhaps this room had not been occupied in a while and there are critters in and around the sewer lines.  After several flushes, the smell dissipated.  The bathroom itself needs a redo, and both the drain area
Manager Response: I apologize for the quality of your stay.  I can assure you that the quality of your stay is not typical of most of our rooms.  Please let my front desk staff know if you have any problems with the room and we can always move you to a different room that better matches your standards.  Of course, I do recognize that the smell and hair does not match anyone's standards.  That's why we're always flexible to move you rooms if you have any problems that we can't solve right away.

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in Buena Park
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel roughly a dozen times over the last five years while on business in the Orange County area.  I have never had a major problem with this hotel.  When I do occasionally have a minor problem, the front desk staff is helpful in correcting it.  The rooms are clean and comfortable and the value is the best in the area for the price.  The entire hotel recently had a makeover which made it even nicer.  The hotel also has a small but nice pool and hot tub area in the back.  Its also conveniently located right across the parking lot from a Target, for those few items you always manage to forget while packing.  A Black Angus Steakhouse is also next door and has a take-out menu available.  The Business King rooms come with mini-fridges,  microwaves and a desk.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your compliments.  I'm very glad to hear that you enjoy your stays.  Please let me know if you have any issues my staff can't take care of.  You can reach me by dialing 459 from the phones in the hotel, or you can email me directly at manager at redroofbp dot com.

Summary Heading: Centrally located to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: Very close to Knotts Berry Farm, Medieval Times, Pirate Show.  Right off the 91 freeway.  A bit hidden and you may drive right past it but the location is superb.  Right in the Target shopping center.  There's Denny's, Black Angus, and a few other food places - I think a Hawaiian BBQ and yogurt.  Rooms are decent size.  Next to freeway so a bit of a noise but not untolerable.  Best part is they allow dogs without an extra charge.  Decent for a Red Roof Inn.
Manager Response: Thanks for spending the time to let me know how your stay was.  I'm glad to hear that you felt we were a good value.  If the freeway noise is too loud, feel free to request a room on the side of our building away from the freeway when checking in.  We'll try our best to accommodate your needs.  Also, I've personally talked to the managers at 10 local restaurants within half a mile to our hotel to give discounts to my guests.  The coupon card for these restaurants are at the front desk.  Thanks again for sharing your review!

Summary Heading: This hotel is perfect for a fun family gettaway to an exiciting location!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the hotel with our two young boys after a visit to Knott's. We were pleasantly surprised with a super clean and comfortable room.  The front desk person was very friendly and she gave us discount coupons for the amusement park, local restaurants and other attractions. She even recommended a great Chinese Buffett nearby which served up delicious food. There's lots to do in this area. The room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable.   We spent most of the day Sunday at the pool after sleeping in until 10 AM.  The pool was well-maintained and with perfect water temperature.  The pool towels were a little small and too thin.  We are definitely coming back for another weekend of adventure!  Especially since it more than met our budget.
Manager Response: I'm very glad to hear you had a good stay.    We usually only put in two sets of towels per room to help minimize the towel load in our machines (to help lower the water and energy usage).  Should you need more towels, please let the front desk know.  We have them stocked at the front desk and if housekeeping hasn't left for the day, we can deliver it to your room.  Thanks for spending the time to write a review on my hotel, and I hope you have a pleasant stay the next time you come.

Summary: Horrible experience, I own a business in which customer service is #1 and I was appalled regarding the way our experience was handled by the manager, Jefferson.   My husband and I shared a couple of drinks nearby and thought it would be better to take a cab and grab an affordable, clean motel near by.  We reached our room late, 12:30a.m., and went straight to bed.   When I woke up around 6:30 a.m. the room was disgusting.  The shower had black goop all over it, the trash cans outside the room were overflowing and birds flocking all over and worst of all there was red drippings all over the inside of the door, this appeared to be blood or ketchup, either way disgusting.  I grabbed our stuff quickly and got out of there in a hurry.  I was only asking for half of our money to be
Manager Response: Customer service is very important to me personally here at the hotel and I'm sorry to hear that her stay did not meet her expectations.  When I heard about her complaints, I immediately went to the room to take pictures of the red stains that she referenced and contacted her by phone.  I could not locate any red liquid that she referenced.  Unfortunately, the fact that I could not verify the red liquid kept our discussion from moving forward.  Should you have any problems with my hotel, please let our front desk staff know as soon as possible.  They can even let me know directly through my cell phone if it's a serious and urgent issue should I not be in the office.  If we don't know about the problems you have with your room, then we won't have an opportunity to fix your issues.  I will work with you personally to resolve any issues you may have.

Summary: I agree with the last reviewer. Things that were annoying: (1) No iron and ironing board in the room. I had to go to the front desk and borrow an iron that was used by every single guest. I had to leave my license with the front desk as collateral. The front desk person told me they had only ONE iron. If that's wrong then you need to tell her to stop telling people that. She giggled at me when I was surprised that it was the ONLY ironing board the hotel had. But it was pretty evident that it was because it was pretty disgusting. The ironing board she gave me was one of those tiny one's you have place on a table. They're horrible to use. I mean... c'mon... Can't they spring for a real ironing board? The ironing board was filthy dirty and stained. I place a pillow case over it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your accurate feedback.  You observed some shortcomings at our hotel that I have noticed as well being a relatively new manager.  Some of the issues you point out are unfortunately the consequence of numerous guests in the past stealing in-room coffee makers, irons, and ironing boards.  The frequency of theft became so high that the hotel owner had to stop offering them in-room.  Instead, they are offered from the front desk in the form of the ID check you referenced and a gourmet cappuccino machine in the lobby.  We do offer many other amenities that local budget hotels may not offer:  1) Microwave & Refrigerators (Select Rooms) 2) Pay-per-view movies 3) Free Wireless Internet 4) Free Kiosk Computer Usage 5) Free pastries and gourmet coffee 6) Heated pool & spa 7) Local restaurant discounts (where I personally met with managers at local restaurants to get my guests special discounts :) ) 8) Arcade Machines 9) Free USA Today Newspaper 10) Coin-Laundry  I'd also like to point out that my housekeeping staff is exceptional and our hotel has responsive management (that's me!).  For any guests thinking about staying at my hotel, please let me or my staff know if you have any problems and give us a chance to take care of it.  Often times there are problems we are not aware of and once we are aware of them we can usually fix it.  You can also contact me directly as well through the front desk.  They have my direct phone line and my e-mail address.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We booked this hotel absolutely last minute (went to medieval times and decided we didnt want to drive all the way home to san diego). The rate was $50 for the night.  Yes, the room is very basic. Yes, we could have definetely used more pillows. For for a last minute, just don't want to drive home place to sleep, its great. It was spotlessly clean. The only really annoying thing was the A/C. It would turn on every half hour or so to cool down the room. If you're coming to orange conty for a long, family vacation. I would not recoment this hotel. If you're here for just the one night, want someplace cheap to rest, I say go for it. For $50 we got a king sized bed, three pollows, a spotless bath, and a Target view.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time for your review.  I'm glad you thought we were a good value and that you recognized the quality of my housekeeping staff!  Though we are on the budget side, please feel free to let our front desk know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.  We have extra pillows at the front, and if the A/C has problems, we can send our maintenance staff to take a look at it.  In addition to our attentive staff, I try and offer extra services which you may not expect at a hotel of our level, such as FREE Wireless Internet, FREE kiosk computer, FREE pastries and gourmet coffee, arcade games, and FREE discounts to local restaurants.  Plus, should you have any problems, please feel free to contact me directly.  My information can be found through the front desk if I'm not in the office.

Summary Heading: terrible customer service and business uses
Summary: my company uses direct bill or i would never stay here again, rude night customer service slow elevators, charges $2.00 per page for a fax and they want that up front such a joke, rooms are musty, room is not done up until 5pm on a daily basis, spa not hot broken furniture in room and then removed and not replaced
Manager Response: I'm sorry your stay wasn't to your satisfaction.  I just came into management on October 2008.  Should you have any future problems, be sure to let me know so that I can deal with them directly.

Summary Heading: First time i had to use RAID at a hotel!
Summary: Most travelers paying for a budget priced hotel or motel end up saying, " Well, you get what you pay for!" Which is completely correct.        Had the Red Roof Inn at Buena Park however, listed among  its amenities that in addition to microwaves and refrigerators, continental breakfast and hi-fi that they had roaches; then I too would agree.       In fact, we did pay a low price which was a great find, or so my husband and I thought initially. The hotel was one of the lower priced among several, so close to Knotts Berry Farm.   But  apparently, not  enough money to handle a roach infestation.       If that problem would have been resolved professionally, I would not be writing a review so lengthy. Imagine finding roaches crawling on the walls, finding a few roaches roaming
Manager Response: ROACHES  We take roach issues VERY seriously.  We have an ongoing, monthly contract with a professional pest control company, IsoTech Pest Management to inspect our building for any sort of roaches.  They inspect ten individual rooms each month and place traps throughout the building.  The room was also inspected by our staff that night, and no signs of roaches were found.  No other complaints have been received about roaches from that room.  RUDE FRONT DESK STAFF  We have since talked to and corrected the Front Desk Staff member.  Never do we tolerate rude behavior from our staff.  This Front Desk Staff member is no longer employed at the hotel.  HOTEL MANAGER'S RESPONSE  Whenever there are guest complaints, we do what we can to resolve them to the satisfaction of the guest.  In this case, we did offer the guest a free upgrade to one of our Suites, but the offer was refused.  YOU GET WHAT YOU PAID FOR?  Though this property may be on the "cheaper" side, you can feel confident that you will be able to address any issues directly to management and the owner, as the owner is on property nearly every day.  Your issues will not be ignored and we will work with you to resolve them.

Summary: This is a great hotel for the price.  The rooms are clean, the staff is somewhat friendly, the cleaning crew is really friendly, and the place is quiet. Our room was a 2 queens with a micro-fridge.  The only problem with that, is that the only rooms that come with the micro-fridge are on the 4th level, and the hotel only has 2 elevators, that were not even close to our room. Other than that, there is really no complaints, the location is awesome, matter of fact, the hotel shares the same parking lot as a target, which is really convenient. I would definately return to this place, and recommend it to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I travel alot both Business and Leisure. I have stayed many week long stays at The Red Roof  Inn Buena Park. It is a safe, clean and well kept property. Everyone from the front desk to maids are helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean, comfortable beds and the High Speed Internet, Cable TV receptions are exceptional! Parking is easy, plenty of restaurants and fast food places near by. If you need something, plenty of stores are in the area. At night, you do get the normal amount of foot and car traffic but its not noisey - just regular hotel/motel sounds one must expect when your at a property with 250 plus guest visiting, vacationing, just having fun. Its not loud at all and not frequent at all, its no big deal unless your a prude. If you want quiet, go across the street and
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff is A-1. Management is only OK, but the staff is amazing. They take care of all of our needs, and always with a smile, from housekeeping to maintenance, and especially the front desk staff. Always look forward to return stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We booked a non-smoking room however our room smelled of smoke (not surpirsed since this seems to be a common problem at a lot of hotels). The good thing was that Target is right behind the hotel so we went to buy some Febreeze and sprayed it, turned up the ACC, opened the door and window, and this took care of most of the smell. The room seemed clean, however, this is a hotel that accepts pets and we were traveling with my 2 year old so I made sure that he was not playing on the floor. The carpet is dark so you can't see if there are any stains on the floor and who knows how often they deep clean those carpets.  We stayed here because it is close to Disneyland (7 miles) and it wasn't real expensive. We went to Disneyland twice and it was
Manager Response: none

Summary: So my boyfriend and I ended up stayin here on New Years Eve thur New Years day.The only reason we stayed here was it was the only thing with rooms near Medieval Times. We Decided to check in and when we walked in the lobby, it smelled liked peanuts. Our room was next to the stairs which I asked not to have a room by but they were all sold out. So at about 12:45ish AM we returned to the hotel to finf a couple of young boys shootin off bottle rockets. So it took the front desk like 20 minuted to take care of it. BTW the side of the hotel we were on is by the freeway so we could hear the cars all night long. Also there were people almost all night long running down the outside halls and yelling. The next morning whwn we checked out we talked to the manager about how we had to call
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good location, just off the highway, assuming you've got a car - which obviously is almost a necessity in CA. Probably 30 minute drive from LAX. Standard 2 queens bed room, good for family of 2 Adults + 2 kids. Located on same development is a Black Steer steakhouse, and a Dennys (outside which there's public telephones from which you can dial direct to UK - found this to be the exception in CA, where a lot of public phones are US only - or go through the operator). Public transport bus from the street outside to Disney ($1 fare), so handy for that. Kids loved the pool - but we're British/Irish and are easily pleased, especially if the sun is shining ! Highly recommended as a family budget motel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After reading the other review listed here, I was afraid of what I would find when I checked in at the Red Roof Inn in Buena Park. In fact, I went ahead and made a reservation at another nearby hotel in case it was too scary to go in. I gave it a shot, though, because this room was only $45 compared with $75 at Hampton Inn. I was only staying one night with my two preschoolers, so I wanted something clean and safe. The lobby was clean and nice, and the elevator to our room was accessed through the lobby, which made me feel a bit safer. The room was nothing special, but it had the basics (beds, tv, table, chairs, tub and shower combo). Everything looked fairly updated and clean. My nonsmoking room did not smell of smoke or anything else. The only problem I had was that the window
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't Waste Your Time and $$$ Here!!
Summary: The Red Roof Inn is the perfect place to stay if like the smell of smoke and urine.  The only bargain you get is on the price of the room.  The front desk staff is absolutely incompetent.  Lacey's entire vocabulary consists of "Huh?", "I don't know" and "That's the way it is".  Try asking her for towels for the pool and her reply will be "Henry will get them for you"  30 minutes later...No Henry and No towels.  God forbid you have trouble getting your key to work on your room.  BIG mistake asking Lacey for help!  All she does is runs it through the magnetizer over and over.  Finally after several tries secruity is called and he tries to open the door.  When he can't get it open they finally call in the Big Manager Gary Brashier.  Wait, wait, wait and after 30 minutes he shows
Manager Response: none
